title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: First, execute Single Site, Exploratory analyses, configured appropriately study, data source. , combine results single table different sites delineated site column. also need edit output_function column reflect table now considered Multi Site, Exploratory output.
code: library(cohortattrition)  my_table <- ca_process(attrition_tbl = my_attrition_counts,                        multi_or_single_site = 'single',                        anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory',                        ...) my_final_results <- my_table1 %>% dplyr::union(my_table2) ... %>%   dplyr::union(my_table_n) %>%   dplyr::mutate(output_function = 'ca_ms_exp_cs')

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: anomaly detection analysis, start executing steps exploratory analysis. , compute_dist_anomalies detect_outliers functions, available squba.gen package, executed results. also need edit output_function column reflect table now considered Multi Site, Anomaly Detection output. Copy code , inputting table generated. var_col whichever numerical column produced exploratory output used target anomaly detection. p_value can selected user.
code: # First execute the compute_dist_anomalies function df_start <- compute_dist_anomalies(df_tbl = my_table,                                    grp_vars = c('step_number', 'attrition_step'),                                    var_col = var_col,                                    denom_cols = c('step_number', 'attrition_step'))  # Then, use that output as input for the detect_outliers function df_final <- detect_outliers(df_tbl = df_start,                             p_input = p_value,                             column_analysis = var_col,                             column_variable = c('step_number', 'attrition_step')) %>%   dplyr::mutate(output_function = 'ca_ms_anom_cs')

title: Multi Site Anomaly Cross-Sectional — ca_ms_anom_cs
text: Multi Site Anomaly Cross-Sectional

title: Multi Site Anomaly Cross-Sectional — ca_ms_anom_cs
code: ca_ms_anom_cs(process_output, output, large_n = FALSE, large_n_sites = NULL)

title: Multi Site Anomaly Cross-Sectional — ca_ms_anom_cs
text: process_output output compute_attrition_diff output column used y-axis:   large_n boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used; defaults FALSE large_n_sites vector site names can optionally generate filtered visualization
code: options are:           `num_pts` (raw patient count),           `prop_retained_start` (proportion patients retained from starting step),           `prop_retained_prior` (proportion patients retained from prior step),           `prop_diff_prior` (proportion difference between each step and the prior step)

title: Multi Site Anomaly Cross-Sectional — ca_ms_anom_cs
text: dot plot indicating anomalous sites based user selected output value
code: anomalies are indicated by STARS, the color of each dot represents the raw output value,     and the size of each dot represents the mean output value per attrition step

title: Multi Site Exploratory Cross-Sectional — ca_ms_exp_cs
text: process_output output compute_attrition_diff log_scale logical determine whether log transform applied y axis output column used y-axis:   large_n boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used; defaults FALSE large_n_sites vector site names can optionally compared summary statistics
code: options are:           `num_pts` (raw patient count),           `prop_retained_start` (proportion patients retained from starting step),           `prop_retained_prior` (proportion patients retained from prior step),           `prop_diff_prior` (proportion difference between each step and the prior step)

title: Cohort Attrition – Output Generation — ca_output
text: Using tabular output generated ca_process, function build graph visualize results. function configuration output bespoke ggplot. Theming can adjusted user graph output using + theme(). graphs can also made interactive using make_interactive_squba()

title: Cohort Attrition – Output Generation — ca_output
code: ca_output(   process_output,   log_scale = FALSE,   var_col = "num_pts",   large_n = FALSE,   large_n_sites = NULL )

title: Cohort Attrition – Output Generation — ca_output
text: process_output tabular input || required tabular output produced ca_process log_scale boolean || default FALSE boolean indicating whether log transformation applied y-axis output var_col string || defaults num_pts name column displayed plot Exploratory analyses. options : num_pts: raw patient count prop_retained_start: proportion patients retained starting step, indicated start_step_num prop_retained_prior: proportion patients retained prior step prop_diff_prior: proportion difference step prior step large_n boolean || defaults FALSE Multi-Site analyses, boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used. visualization produce high level summaries across sites, option add specific site comparators via large_n_sites parameter. large_n_sites vector || defaults NULL large_n = TRUE, vector site names can add site-level information plot comparison across high level summary information.

title: Cohort Attrition – Output Generation — ca_output
text: function produce graph visualize results ca_process based parameters provided. default output typically static ggplot gt object, interactive elements can activated passing plot make_interactive_squba. detailed description output specific check type, see PEDSpace metadata repository

title: Cohort Attrition – Output Generation — ca_output
Cohort Attrition — ca_process
text: plausibility module assess attrition counts counts change step next help identify impactful potentially anomalous attrition criteria. user provide precomputed attrition. sample attrition_tbl expected formatting can found using cohortattrition::.

title: Cohort Attrition — ca_process
code: ca_process(   attrition_tbl,   multi_or_single_site = "single",   anomaly_or_exploratory = "exploratory",   start_step_num = 0,   var_col = "num_pts",   p_value = 0.9 )

title: Cohort Attrition — ca_process
text: attrition_tbl tabular input || required table CSV file attrition information site included cohort. table minimally contain: site | character | name institution step_number | integer | numeric identifier attrition step attrition_step | character | description attrition step num_pts | integer | patient count attrition step multi_or_single_site string || defaults single string, either single multi, indicating whether single-site multi-site analysis executed anomaly_or_exploratory string || defaults exploratory string, either anomaly exploratory, indicating type results produced. Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. start_step_num integer || defaults 0 step_number attrition_tbl considered "start" analysis. drive comparisons later steps start. var_col string || defaults num_pts name column used conduct analysis Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional check. options : num_pts: raw patient count prop_retained_start: proportion patients retained starting step, indicated start_step_num prop_retained_prior: proportion patients retained prior step prop_diff_prior: proportion difference step prior step p_value numeric || defaults 0.9 p value used threshold Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional analysis

title: Cohort Attrition — ca_process
text: function return dataframe original attrition information, plus columns examining difference step others. Multi-Site, Anomaly Detection, Cross-Sectional check run, output also include descriptive statistics chosen var_col indication sites outliers attrition step.
